alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 11 at 10:35PM CST until January 11 at 11:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CST FOR WESTERN BENTON...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHERN DELAWARE... NORTHERN ADAIR AND NORTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 1034 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Scraper to near Eldon, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Fayetteville... Bentonville... Tahlequah... Siloam Springs... Farmington... Gentry... Tontitown... Gravette... Decatur... Westville... West Siloam Springs... Colcord... Kansas... Highfill... Watts... Oaks... Springtown... Christie... Northwest Arkansas Regional Air... Cincinnati... This includes Interstate 49 near mile marker 65. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tulsa.
